alert.note: Alert for Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 9:13PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Shannon and east central Texas Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 913 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Raymondville, or 11 miles east of Houston, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Echo Bluff State Park... Current River State Park... Ozark National Scenic Riverways... Summersville... Raymondville... Hartshorn... Round Spring... Akers... Eunice... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
